title: American_Top_40_1985_September_28th
description:
"Radio plays 'em, record stores sell 'em, Billboard ranks 'em and AT40 counts 'em down."


American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This is a recording of a rebroadcast from internet radio.

In this broadcast:

A listener wants to know, "What was the very first number one song on the very first chart of the rock era back in January, 1955?" It's the first song that played on the radio in the DeLorean in "Back To The Future" when it traveled back in time to 1955.

Eivets Rednow has a harmonica solo on one of the songs in the bottom 10. He also has a solo hit in the third hour.

Only three songs that mention a specific time of day have ever hit number one (like "Midnight Train To Georgia"). Casey gives the details.

A listener wants to know, "What television shows of the 1980's have theme songs that have hit the top 40?" Casey names five.

One artist in the countdown turned down a chance to act in Steven Spielburg's "The Color Purple."

LW#1: Money For Nothing - Dire Straits
